item.title: Developing my functions
item.description: I have been a late bloomer in terms of developing my own tool box of functions and finally starting to see the opportunities to use functions and even to write my own packages. I use this function in many of my scripts to remind me of how easy it is write your own function. read_attendance <- function(rds) { read_rds(rds) A rule of thumb is that writing a script twice means it is time to write a function; I think I managed to write a varaition of the same script 6 times before it dawned on me this should be a function.

item.title: Reviewing Functions
item.description: I am starting on the new year of project and was revisiting some functions. I had a function that created a csv file of duplicate values for every organization that submitted data. The function was useful but a pain to run the function for every organization on separate chunks. I figured there had to be better way. The following is an incremental improvement to the old process but I do have a sense there is a better way.
